isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - FE 300, RE 200, RE 300 - RE 200/RE 300 CHASSIS ACCESSORIES - TROUBLESHOOTING

svcprocinfo.para: Before beginning these test procedures, do the following:

item.para: Make sure the vehicle batteries are at 75% state of charge (SOC) or higher. This represents an open circuit voltage (OCV) of 12.4 volts. Batteries with an OCV of 12 volts or less are either completely discharged or have a dead cell.
Check any light or indicator lamp filaments that are suspected of being open (burned out). This is done to avoid unnecessary extensive circuit checks.
Inspect all connectors for loose or damaged pins, wires, etc. Refer to TEST EQUIPMENT AND CONNECTOR REPAIR section in GROUP 08 - ELECTRICAL in the Master Service Manual.

When the technician determines that a fuse is blown, while checking its condition, he is directed to locate the cause of the overload condition and to repair it. While no further instruction on this procedure is listed in the diagnostic tables, the common procedure is as follows: isolate sections of the circuit by disconnecting connectors, and measure the resistance to ground to find the circuit that is shorted to ground. Then locate the damaged spot in the wire or connector and repair.

Diagnostics for circuits that are malfunctioning by sticking in the on position are generally not covered in detail. It is assumed that the technician knows to check for a malfunctioning switch, relay, or solenoid.

entry.para: Check rear control box fuse B3 for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
At fuse B3, measure voltage from circuit V13P to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit V13P, then repair. Install fuse.
Disconnect air dryer connector (6705). Turn key on and measure voltage from circuit K39B to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit K39B, conn. (6705), circuit K39B/K39, conn. (6000) or circuit 39, then repair.
At (6705) measure voltage across circuit K39 to K39-GA.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit K39-GA, conn. (6705), circuit K39-G/ K11-GJ, then repair.
At (6705) install jumper from circuit K39B to heater element feed. With key on and unit cooled to below 50°F (10°C), measure voltage from element ground terminal to ground.
Repair or replace heated air dryer.
Remove jumper wire and reconnect connector (6705). Air dryer circuitry checks good.
Check rear control box fuse A3 for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
At fuse A3, measure voltage from circuit V13L to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit V13L, then repair. Install fuse.
Disconnect air dryer/ drain valve connector (42). Turn key on and measure voltage from circuit K39A (red) to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit K39A or drain valve to chassis harness conn. (43), chassis to electronic engine harness conn. (9850), or control box conn. (6000), then repair.
At (42) measure voltage across circuit K39A (red) to N39-GA (brown).
Locate open or poor connection in circuit N39-G, conn. (43), or circuit N39-G/ N11-GA/ N11-GB, then repair.
At (42) install jumper from circuit K39A to heater element feed. With key on and unit cooled to below 50°F (10°C), measure voltage from element ground terminal to ground.
Remove jumper and reconnect pigtail connector. Drain valve circuitry checks good.

svcsubproc.title: Heated Fuel Filter With Water-In-Fuel Light, Fuel Filter Restriction Light

table.title: Heated Fuel Filter With Water-In-Fuel Light, Fuel Filter Restriction Light

entry.para: Does the fuel filter restriction light work properly?
Does the water-in-fuel system operate properly?
Does the heated fuel filter work properly?
Remove fuel heater relay (R5). At relay connector, measure voltage from cavity E, circuit A19H to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage condition in circuit A19H, or open fuse F17, then repair.
At relay connector, measure voltage from cavity B, circuit A19D to ground.
(R5) socket, cav. B, A19D to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A19D, or open fuse F20, then repair.
At relay socket (R5), measure voltage from cavity B to cavity A, circuit A11-GM/A11-GB.
(R5) socket, cav. B to A, A11-GM/A11-GB.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit A11-GM/A11-GB. then repair.
Bench test fuel filter relay (R5) by measuring resistance from pin 30 to 87A.
Apply +12V to relay pin 86 and ground to pin 85. Measure resistance from pin 30 to 87.
Reconnect relay (R5) and disconnect circuit A19A from fuel filter. Turn key on and measure voltage from circuit A19A to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A19A, dash conn. (2), or fuel filter conn. (6704 or 6708), then repair.
With the fuel heater cooled to below 50°F (10°C), measure voltage from circuit N19A to the heater power stud.
Fuel filter, N19A to heater power stud.
Heated fuel filter system checks good.
Repair or replace heated fuel filter.
Disconnect water-in-fuel module (16). Turn key on and at connector, measure voltage from circuit A19E to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage condition in circuit A19E, then repair.
At WIF socket (3116), measure voltage across circuit A19E to A19-GB.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit A19-GB, or key switch, then repair.
At WIF socket (3116), install jumper from circuit A19E to A19F. Does warning light operate?
Disconnect WIF warning light conn. (9) and at circuit A19F, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage condition in circuit A19F, then repair.
At WIF connector (9), measure voltage across circuit A19F to A19-G.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit A19-G/ A11-GB/ A11-G, then repair.
At WIF connector (3116) move jumper across circuit A19E to A19C. At the fuel filter, disconnect circuit A19C from the water probe. Turn key on and measure voltage from circuit A19C to ground.
Water probe conn., A19C to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage condition in circuit A19C, dash conn. (2), or fuel filter conn. (6704 or 6708), then repair.
Remove jumper and reconnect WIF module (3116). At water probe connector, jumper circuit A19C to ground. Does light work?
Remove water probe and install jumper from the probe to ground. Measure voltage from circuit A19C to water probe feed stud.
Water probe, A19C to probe feed stud.
Install probe and connections. WIF system checks good.
Remove fuel filter light connector (69) and measure voltage from circuit A19J to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A19J or open fuse F25, then repair.
Reconnect light connector (69) and disconnect fuel filter switch connector (N/L). Measure voltage from circuit A19B to ground.
Filter switch conn., A19B to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A19B, dash conn. (2), or fuel filter conn. (6704 or 6708), then repair.
Fuel filter restriction light circuitry checks good. If condition persists, replace fuel filter switch.
Are both the engine (0x00) and the MSM (aka ESC) on the Datalink?
Does the input in MD change with the switch changes?
Does the input in MD change with the switch changes?
MSM is functioning properly. Check that cruise control is enabled in the engine controller
1. Verify Cruise ON/OFF switch and wiring, OFF state
Is pin 8 open to ignition when switch is OFF?
Repair wiring or switch, and retest
1. Verify Cruise ON/OFF switch and wiring, ON state
Is pin 8 shorted to ignition when switch is ON?
Repair wiring or switch, and retest
1. Verify Cruise SET/RES switch and wiring, normal state
Is pin 9 open to ground and ignition when switch is not pressed?
Repair wiring or switch, and retest
1. Verify Cruise SET/RES switch and wiring, RESUME state
Is pin 9 shorted to ground when switch is moved to RESUME?
Repair wiring or switch, and retest
1. Verify Cruise SET/RES switch and wiring, SET state
2. Turn Cruise ON/OFF switch to ON
Is pin 9 shorted to ignition when switch is moved to SET?
Repair wiring or switch, and retest
Is the engine (0x00) on the Datalink?
3. Measure resistance across datalink pins in wiring harness
2. Measure the voltage at the MSM's harness ignition pin
1. Measure the resistance between the MSM's harness ground pin and ground
Is the resistance less than 10 ohms?
Is the MSM (aka ESC) on the Datalink?
Check the engine's power connections and data link wiring.
Remove circuit breaker F21. and check for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
At fuse holder, measure voltage from circuit 90B to ground. Re-install fuse.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuits 90-FL/90/90B, dash conn. (2), or circuit 90B, then repair or replace cable assembly.
Disconnect MSM connector (3041). Turn key and cruise switch (391) on. At (3041), measure voltage from circuit 97CF cavity 8 to ground.
Disconnect cruise on/off switch (391) and with switch in on position, measure resistance across terminals.
At Brake/Cruise Interface Relay connector (1133), measure voltage from circuit 97B to ground. Reconnect connectors.
Repair open or poor con- nection in circuit 97B.
Check open circuit breaker F13. If okay, locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 97B, then repair.
With on/off switch on and set/resume switch held in set position, measure voltage at MSM connector (3041) from circuit 97CA cavity 9 to ground.
Disconnect cruise set/resume switch (392). With switch held in set position, measure resistance across terminals 1 to 2.
With on/off switch on and at connector (392), measure voltage from circuit 97DH to ground. Reconnect connectors.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 97CA, then repair.
With on/off switch on and set/resume switch held in resume position, measure voltage at MSM connector (3041) from circuit 97DK cavity 9 to ground.
Disconnect cruise set/resume switch (392). With switch held in resume position, measure resistance across terminals 2 to 3. Reconnect connectors.
Repair open in cir. 97-GE, 97-GJ 97DK, or poor con- nection to Cab ground.
Is the vehicle equipped with remote engine controls?
Disconnect body builder installed remote engine controls connector (N/L) at cowl power distribution center. At connector, measure voltage from circuit 97DF to ground.
Remote engine controls conn. (N/L), 97DF to gnd.
Check for open circuit breaker F11. If OK, locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 97DF, dash conn. (3), or circuit 97DF, then repair.
Measure resistance of circuit 46B between (N/L) connector circuit 46B and ECM2 connector (6020), cavity 21.
Locate open in circuit 46B, then repair.
Measure resistance of circuit 46A between (N/L) connector circuit 46A and ECM2 connector (6020), cavity 14.
Locate open in circuit 46A, then repair.
Measure resistance of circuit 97CC between (N/L) connector and ECM2 connector (6020), cavity 20.
Locate open in circuit 97CC, then repair.
Measure resistance of circuit 97CB between (N/L) connector and ECM2 connector (6020), cavity 19.
Locate open in circuit 97CB, then repair.
Measure resistance of circuit 97AR between (N/L) connector and ECM2 connector (6020), cavity 11.
Locate open in circuit 97AR, then repair.
Measure resistance of circuit 47B between (N/L) connector and ECM2 connector (6020), cavity 17.
Locate open in circuit 47B, then repair.
Reconnect connectors. If condition persists, refer to Miscellaneous Information in CT-471 Body Builder Book.
Reconnect connectors. Cruise control circuitry checks good. If condition persists, refer to Engine Diagnostic Manuals for ECM2 diagnostics.
Remove pump control relay (R1) and measure voltage from circuit A90 to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in fusible link N90-FL/ N90FA, circuit A90, or conn. (2), then repair.
At relay socket (R1), install jumper wire from cavity E, circuit A90 to cavity C, circuit A90S. Does pump motor run?
At pump motor, disconnect connector and measure voltage from circuit A90S to ground.
Pump motor conn., A90S to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A90S or conn. (2) or (88), then repair.
At pump motor connector, measure voltage from circuit N90S to pump casing.
Pump motor conn., N90S to pump case.
Locate open or poor connection in ground circuit from pump case to platform ground, then repair.
Bench test relay (R1) by measuring resistance from pin 30 to 87A.
Bench test relay by applying +12 volts to pin 85, ground to pin 86, and measure resistance from pin 30 to 87.
Remove fuse F2 and check for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
At fuse F2, measure voltage from cavity A, circuit A90A to ground.
F2, cav. A, A90A to gnd.
Install fuse. Go to next step.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A90A or dash conn. (2), then repair. Re-install fuse.
Remove fuse F12 and check for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
At fuse F12, measure voltage from cavity A, circuit A14A to ground.
F12, cav. A, A14A to gnd.
Install fuse. Go to next step.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A14A, then repair. Re-install fuse.
Remove fuse F18 and check for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
At fuse F18, measure voltage from cavity A, circuit A13A to ground.
F18, cav. A, A13A to gnd.
Install fuse. Go to next step.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A13A, then repair. Re-install fuse.
Remove stop light relay (R4). At socket cavity B circuit A70D, measure voltage to ground.
(R4) socket, cav. B, A70D to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A70D or A70B, then repair.
Bench test relay (R4) by measuring resistance from pin 30 to 87A.
Bench test relay by applying +12 volts to pin 85, ground to pin 86, and measure resistance from pin 30 to 87.
Remove brake relay (R3). Measure resistance of circuit A70-G between cavity A of relay (R3) and cavity D of relay (R4).
Locate open or poor connection in circuit A70-G, then repair.
Re-install relay (R4). At relay (R3) socket, measure voltage from cavity E, circuit A90X to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A90U or A90X, then repair.
Bench test relay (R3) by measuring resistance from pin 30 to 87A.
Bench test relay by applying +12 volts to pin 85, ground to pin 86, and measure resistance from pin 30 to 87.
Re-install relay (R3). Disconnect connector from brake/stop light switch (209). At connector, measure voltage from circuit N90B to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit N90B, or dash conn. (2), then repair.
At connector (209), measure resistance from circuit N90-G to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit N90-G/ N11-GB, then repair.
At connector (209), measure voltage from circuit N70C to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit N70C or dash conn. (2), then repair.
At switch (209) and with brake pedal applied, measure resistance from blue wire terminal to black wire terminal.
Reconnect (209) and disconnect flow switch connector (N/L). Measure resistance from switch terminal to ground.
Reconnect flow switch connector and disconnect differential pressure switch connector (91). Measure resistance from circuit N90L to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit N90L, then repair.
At switch (91), measure resistance from each terminal to ground.
Reconnect switch (91) and disconnect connector (88). At (88) measure resistance from circuit N90K to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit N90K, then repair.
Disconnect monitor module connector (86). At connector (86-A), measure resistance from circuit A90L to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit A90L/A90K, then repair.
At relay socket (R1), measure resistance from cavity A, circuit A90E to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit A90E, then repair.
Remove blocking diode from connector (80). With pedal depressed, measure voltage from circuit A90F to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A90F, then repair.
At (80) measure voltage from circuit A90T to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A90T, then repair.
With multimeter in diode test mode, test diode (80). Does diode test good?
Re-install diode (80). With brake pedal depressed and at monitor module connector (86), measure voltage from (86-H) circuit A90C, and (86-G) circuit A90D to ground.
(86-H), A90C to gnd., (86-G), A90D to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A90C and/or 90D, then repair.
At (86-E), measure voltage from circuit A90H to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A90H, then repair.
At (86-D), measure resistance from circuit 11-GD to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 11-GD/ 11-GB/ 11-G, then repair.
At pump control relay socket (R1), measure voltage from circuit A90J to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A90J, then repair.
Re-install pump control relay (R1). Turn key on and at connector (86-F), measure voltage from circuit N90Q to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit N90Q, dash conn. (2) or conn. (88), then repair.
Disconnect alarm blocking diode (25). At connector, measure voltage from alarm circuit A90NA to ground. Alarm should activate.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A90NA, fuse F24 and alarm feed circuit A13B, or check alarm operation, then repair.
With multimeter in diode test mode, test diode (25). Does diode test good?
At connector (25), measure voltage from warning light circuit A90N/A90M to ground. Warning light should activate.
Locate cause of low or no voltage condition in circuit A90N, cluster conn. (12), printed circuit board, or feed circuitA28C, then repair.
Measure resistance of circuit A90M between connectors (25) and (86-C).
Locate open in circuit A90M, then repair.
Re-install monitor module (86). Disconnect body builder connector (169). With brakes applied, measure voltage from circuit A70A to ground.
Reconnect conn. (169). Go to next step.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A70A, then repair.
Hydraulic brake pump motor and stop light circuitry checks good. With brakes applied, does pump motor run?
With engine not running and brakes released, does pump motor run and warning system activate?
With engine running, does alarm system deactivate?
